page.title: 17RUBISLAW QUARRY, ABERDEEN
page.content: The grey granite for which Aberdeen is famous was mainly extracted from Rubislaw Quarry which was begun in 1740 and ceased production in 1969 when, with a depth of over 150m, it was one of the world's largest quarries. Since then, the quarry has begun to fill with water and has posed problems for the council as to how the site should be developed. Plans for a unique quarry view hotel and suggestions for use as a rubbish dump were discarded in favour of new buildings to house the offices of major oil companies, Marathon, Britoil and Conoco.
